intro: Zieria whitei, commonly known as the white zieria, is a small shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. Zieria whitei is often found in heathlands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native gardens and conservation landscapes.
